page.title: 03LOCAL GOVERNMENT IN NEWTOWN
page.content: Soberton and Newtown Parish Council meet once a month, alternating between Soberton Village Hall and Rookesbury Hall. It has 11 elected coucillors and has its first lady chairman (1985). The main functions and concerns are: expressing to the higher tiers of government the opinions of those in the parishes, e.g. the routing of heavy lorries, care of the environment and the illegal siting of mobile homes; roads in the district are inspected; rights of parishioners are defended; it has concern for the welfare of the young. The parish rate is two pence in the Â£. and the majority is spent maintaining the recreation ground and pavillion. Similar parish councils exist in the other areas but all come under Winchester City Council, to whom rates are paid.
